_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:18:13 using v2.0
title: How have medication errors causing severe harm and death changed over time?
analysis_commentary:
As with all indicators drawn from incident reporting the observed rates will be influenced by the general reporting level.

Over time, the rate of medication errors which resulted in severe harm or death has decreased in the NHS. Between April 2011 and March 2012, there were 0.49 medication errors that resulted in severe harm or death per 100,000 population, compared to 0.77 between January 2008 and December 2008. Note: There are no data available for October 2008 to September 2009.
